Welcome

About Me

A hard working lifelong learner, father of two girls who in the last two years whilst in full-time employment has taught himself to code. I have worked in factories and fields for 20 years but now I have a direction that requires programming skills.

I am dyslexic and in the '80s there was not much help so my school put me in the remedial class for the entirety of my time there, I found from an early age that I had to teach myself to read and write so I did.

The problem with being self-taught is you don't really know what you need to know. On the plus side I don't think like most, I applied and was selected for a Google challenge to Udacity for a full scholarship for a Front-end Nano Degree. Udacity and Free Code Camp helped direct my progress, time for the next challenge. ðŸ˜Ž

Projec Memory

In this project, youâ€™ll demonstrate your mastery of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript by building a complete browser-based card matching game (also known as Concentration). From building a grid of cards, adding functionality to handle user input, and implementing gameplay logic -- you'll combine all your web development skills to create a fully interactive experience for your users.

 Javascript Game

In this project, youâ€™ll recreate the classic arcade game Frogger. You will be provided visual assets and a game loop engine; using these tools you must add a number of entities to the game including the player characters and enemies.

 Restaurant Review

For this project, you will convert a static webpage to a mobile-ready web application. You will take a static design that lacks accessibility and converts the design to be responsive on different sized displays and accessible for screen reader users. You will also begin converting this to a Progressive Web Application by caching some assets for offline use.
